 13342                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13343                                  
 13344                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13345                                  
 13346                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13347                                  ;
 13348                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13349                                  ;
 13350                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13351                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13352                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13353                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13354                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13355                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13356                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13357                                  ;
 13358                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13359                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13360                                  ;
 13361                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13362                                  
 13363                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13364                                  HMAPtr:
 13365 0000139F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13366                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13367 000013A4 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13368                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13369 000013A8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13370 000013AB 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13371 000013AD 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13372                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13373 000013B2 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13374 000013B4 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13375                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13376 000013B8 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13377                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13378                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13379 000013BC C3                      		retn
 13380                                  
 13381                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13382                                  
 13383                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13384                                  
 13385                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13386                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13387                                  
 13388                                  move_sector:
 13389                                  
 13390                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13391                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13392                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13393                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13394                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13395                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13396                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13397                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13398                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13399                                  ;
 13400                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13401                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13402                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13403                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13404                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13405                                  
 13406 000013BD FC                      		cld
 13407 000013BE 51                      		push	cx
 13408 000013BF B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13409 000013C2 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13410 000013C6 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13411 000013C8 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13412 000013CC 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13413 000013CE F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13414 000013D0 59                      		pop	cx
 13415 000013D1 C3                      		retn
 13416                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13417                                  
 13418                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13419 000013D2 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13420 000013D4 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13421 000013D6 59                      		pop	cx
 13422 000013D7 C3                      		retn
 13423                                  
 13424                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13425                                  
 13426                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13427                                  
 13428                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13429                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13430                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13431                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13432                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13433                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13434                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13435                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13436                                  ;
 13437                                  ; input conditions:
 13438                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13439                                  ;
 13440                                  ; output:
 13441                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13442                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13443                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13444                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13445                                  
 13446                                  check_wrap:	
 13447 000013D8 50                      		push	ax
 13448 000013D9 53                      		push	bx
 13449 000013DA 06                      		push	es
 13450 000013DB 57                      		push	di
 13451 000013DC E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13452 000013DF 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13453                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13454 000013E1 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13455                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13456 000013E6 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13457 000013E8 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13458 000013EC 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13459 000013EE 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13460 000013F1 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13461 000013F3 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13462 000013F5 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13463                                  
 13464                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13465                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13466                                  
 13467 000013F7 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13468 000013F9 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13469                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13470 000013FB 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13471 000013FC 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13472                                  					; if on	boundary
 13473                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13474                                  not_on_bound:				
 13475 000013FE 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13476 00001401 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13477 00001403 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13478 00001405 40                      		inc	ax
 13479 00001406 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13480 00001408 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13481                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13482 0000140B 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13483 0000140F 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13484                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13485                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13486 00001411 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13487 00001413 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13488 00001414 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13489                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13490 00001416 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13491                                  
 13492                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13493                                  
 13494 00001418 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13495 0000141A 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13496 0000141C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13497                                  
 13498                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13499                                  
 13500 0000141E 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13501 00001420 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13502 00001422 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13503                                  no_head_bound:				
 13504 00001423 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13505 00001425 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13506 00001426 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13507 00001428 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13508 0000142A 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13509 0000142C 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13510 0000142F B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13511 00001431 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13512 00001433 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13513 00001435 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13514 00001437 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13515 00001439 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13516 0000143B 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13517 0000143D 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13518                                  no_wrap:				
 13519 0000143F F8                      		clc
 13520 00001440 5F                      		pop	di
 13521 00001441 07                      		pop	es
 13522 00001442 5B                      		pop	bx
 13523 00001443 58                      		pop	ax
 13524 00001444 C3                      		retn
 13525                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13526                                  
 13527                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13528 00001445 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13529 00001447 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13530 00001449 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13531                                  
 13532                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13533                                  
 13534                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13535                                  
 13536                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13537                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13538                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13539                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13540                                  ;
 13541                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13542                                  
 13543                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13544                                  find_bds:	
 13545 0000144B C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13546                                  fbds_1:					
 13547 0000144F 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13548 00001453 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13549 00001455 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13550                                  					; go to next bds
 13551 00001458 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13552 0000145B 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13553 0000145D F9                      		stc
 13554                                  fdbs_2:					
 13555 0000145E C3                      		retn
 13556                                  
 13557                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13558                                  
 13559                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13560                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13561                                  doint:
 13562                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13563 0000145F 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13564                                  					; get physical drive number
 13565                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13566                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13567                                  		
 13568 00001462 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13569 00001464 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13570 00001466 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13571                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13572 00001468 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13573                                  					; get request code
 13574                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13575 0000146B FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13576                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13577 0000146E 9D                      		popf
 13578                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13579                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13580 0000146F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13581                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13582                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13583 00001474 9C                      		pushf
 13584                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13585 00001475 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13586                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13587                                  dointdone:				
 13588 00001478 C3                      		retn
 13589                                  
 13590                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13591                                  
 13592                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13593                                  
 13594                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13595                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13596                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13597                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13598                                  ;
 13599                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13600                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13601                                  ;
 13602                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13603                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13604                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13605                                  
 13606                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13607                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13608                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13609                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13610                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13611                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13612                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13613                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13614                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13615                                  ;end struc
 13616                                  
 13617                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13618                                  
 13619                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13620                                  ;	ah = function
 13621                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13622                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13623                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13624                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13625                                  ;   output conditions:
 13626                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13627                                  
 13628                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13629                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13630                                  ;
 13631                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13632                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13633                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13634                                  
 13635                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13636                                  
 13637                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13638                                  
 13639 00001479 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13640                                  
 13641                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13642                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13643                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13644                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13645                                  
 13646                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13647                                  
 13648                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13649                                  
 13650                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13651                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13652                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13653                                  
 13654                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13655 0000147D 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13656 00001482 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13657 00001484 53                      		push	bx
 13658 00001485 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13659 00001488 E83004                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13660 0000148B 5B                      		pop	bx
 13661 0000148C EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13662                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13663                                  
 13664                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13665                                  
 13666                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13667                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13668                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13669                                  
 13670                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13671                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13672 0000148E 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13673 00001490 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13674 00001492 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13675 00001493 51                      		push	cx
 13676 00001494 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13677 00001496 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13678 00001498 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13679 0000149A 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13680 0000149E 59                      		pop	cx
 13681 0000149F 58                      		pop	ax
 13682 000014A0 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13683                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13684 000014A2 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13685 000014A3 06                      		push	es
 13686                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13687 000014A4 2EC41E[7914]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13688                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13689                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13690 000014A9 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13691 000014AB 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13692 000014AE 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13693                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13694                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13695 000014B2 07                      		pop	es
 13696 000014B3 5B                      		pop	bx
 13697 000014B4 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13698                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13699                                  
 13700                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13701                                  
 13702                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13703                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13704                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13705                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13706                                  
 13707                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13708 000014B6 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13709                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13710 000014BB 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13711 000014BD 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13712                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13713 000014C2 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13714                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13715 000014C4 50                      		push	ax
 13716 000014C5 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13717                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13718                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13719 000014C7 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13720                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13721                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13722 000014CC 58                      		pop	ax
 13723 000014CD EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13724                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13725                                  
 13726                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13727                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13728                                  
 13729                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13730                                  
 13731                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13732                                  
 13733                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13734                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13735                                  
 13736                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13737 000014CF 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13738                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13739                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13740 000014D0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13741                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13742                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13743                                  
 13744                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13745                                  
 13746 000014D5 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13747 000014D8 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13748 000014DB 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13749                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13750                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13751 000014DD 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13752 000014E2 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13753                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13754                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13755                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13756 000014E4 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13757                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13758                                  		
 13759 000014E9 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13760                                  		
 13761 000014EA 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13762                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13763 000014EF 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13764                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13765                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13766 000014F1 9D                      		popf
 13767 000014F2 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13768                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13769 000014F4 1F                      		pop	ds
 13770 000014F5 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13771                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13772                                  
 13773                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13774                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13775                                  ; a changeline error.
 13776                                  
 13777                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13778 000014F8 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13779                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13780 000014FA 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13781 000014FD 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13782 000014FF 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13783 00001501 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13784 00001503 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13785 00001508 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13786                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13787                                  					; never	would
 13788 0000150A 53                      		push	bx
 13789 0000150B BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13790 0000150E E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13791 00001511 5B                      		pop	bx
 13792                                  int13b:					
 13793 00001512 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13794 00001513 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13795                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13796                                  
 13797                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13798                                  
 13799                                  goterr13:				
 13800 00001515 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13801 00001518 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13802                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13803 0000151A 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13804 0000151D 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13805 0000151F 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13806 00001524 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13807                                  
 13808 00001526 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13809                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13810                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13811                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13812 0000152B 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13813                                  
 13814 0000152D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13815                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13816                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13817 0000152F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13818                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13819                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13820 00001534 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13821 00001537 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13822 00001539 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13823 0000153B 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13824 0000153D 53                      		push	bx
 13825 0000153E 51                      		push	cx
 13826 0000153F 52                      		push	dx
 13827 00001540 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13828                                  loop_ecc:				
 13829 00001543 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13830                                  
 13831                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13832                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13833                                  ;
 13834                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13835                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13836                                  ; track.
 13837                                  ;
 13838                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13839                                  ; this request.
 13840                                  ;
 13841                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13842                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13843                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13844                                  ;
 13845 00001546 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13846                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13847                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13848 00001549 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13849                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13850 0000154E 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13851 00001550 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13852 00001553 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13853 00001555 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13854 00001558 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13855                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13856                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13857                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13858 0000155A 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13859                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13860                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13861                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13862                                  ok11_op:				
 13863 0000155C FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13864 00001560 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13865 00001562 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13866                                  					; add 200h to address
 13867 00001564 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13868 00001566 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13869 00001568 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13870                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13871                                  
 13872                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13873                                  
 13874                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13875 0000156A F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13876                                  ok11_exit:				
 13877 0000156B 5A                      		pop	dx
 13878 0000156C 59                      		pop	cx
 13879 0000156D 5B                      		pop	bx
 13880 0000156E EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13882                                  
 13883                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13884                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13885                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13886                                  
 13887                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13888 00001570 06                      		push	es
 13889 00001571 53                      		push	bx
 13890 00001572 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13891 00001575 1E                      		push	ds
 13892 00001576 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13893 00001577 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13894                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13895                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13896 0000157A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13897                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13898 0000157F 5B                      		pop	bx
 13899 00001580 07                      		pop	es
 13900 00001581 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13901 00001583 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13902 00001586 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13903                                  
 13904                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13905                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13906                                  
 13907                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13908 00001588 56                      		push	si
 13909 00001589 57                      		push	di
 13910 0000158A 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13911 0000158C BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13912 0000158F E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 13913 00001592 5F                      		pop	di
 13914 00001593 5E                      		pop	si
 13915 00001594 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13916                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13917                                  
 13918                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13919                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13920                                  
 13921                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13922 00001596 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13923 00001599 FB                      		sti
 13924 0000159A 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13925 0000159D 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13926                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13927                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13928 0000159F 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13929 000015A2 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13930 000015A4 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13931 000015A7 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13932 000015A9 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13933                                  
 13934                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13935                                  
 13936                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13937                                  
 13938 000015AB 52                      		push	dx
 13939 000015AC 51                      		push	cx
 13940 000015AD 53                      		push	bx
 13941 000015AE 50                      		push	ax
 13942 000015AF 55                      		push	bp
 13943 000015B0 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13944 000015B2 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13945 000015B4 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13946 000015B6 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13947 000015B8 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13948 000015BA D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13949 000015BC 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13950 000015BE 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13951                                  
 13952                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13953                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13954                                  
 13955 000015C2 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13956 000015C4 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13957                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13958                                  
 13959                                  no_skip_first:				
 13960 000015C7 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13961 000015C9 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13962 000015CB 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13963                                  
 13964                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13965                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13966                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13967                                  ;
 13968                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13969                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13970                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13971                                  ; in error.
 13972                                  
 13973 000015CD 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13974 000015CF 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13975                                  
 13976                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13977                                  
 13978 000015D1 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13979                                  					; set up head number
 13980 000015D4 E888FE                  		call	doint
 13981 000015D7 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13982                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13983                                  
 13984                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13985 000015DA B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13986 000015DC F9                      		stc
 13987 000015DD E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13988                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13989                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13990                                  
 13991                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13992                                  
 13993                                  intverify:				
 13994 000015E0 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13995 000015E1 53                      		push	bx
 13996 000015E2 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13997 000015E3 07                      		pop	es
 13998                                  dosimple:				
 13999 000015E4 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14000                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14001                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14002                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14003 000015E7 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14004                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14005 000015EC 5B                      		pop	bx
 14006 000015ED 07                      		pop	es
 14007 000015EE E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14008                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14009                                  
 14010                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14011                                  
 14012                                  intformat:				
 14013 000015F1 06                      		push	es
 14014 000015F2 53                      		push	bx
 14015 000015F3 56                      		push	si
 14016 000015F4 57                      		push	di
 14017 000015F5 1E                      		push	ds
 14018                                  
 14019                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14020                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14021                                  
 14022 000015F6 06                      		push	es
 14023 000015F7 1E                      		push	ds
 14024 000015F8 07                      		pop	es
 14025 000015F9 1F                      		pop	ds
 14026 000015FA 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14027 000015FC BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14028 000015FF E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14029 00001602 1F                      		pop	ds
 14030 00001603 5F                      		pop	di
 14031 00001604 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14032 00001605 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14033                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14034                                  
 14035                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14036                                  ; the first block.
 14037                                  ;
 14038                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14039                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14040                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14041                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14042                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14043                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14044                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14045                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14046                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14047                                  
 14048                                  doblock:
 14049                                  
 14050                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14051                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14052                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14053                                  				
 14054 00001607 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14055                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14056 0000160A 51                      		push	cx
 14057 0000160B 06                      		push	es
 14058 0000160C 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14059                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14060 0000160D E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14061 00001610 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14062                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14063 00001614 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14064                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14065 00001619 5F                      		pop	di
 14066 0000161A 07                      		pop	es
 14067 0000161B 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14068 0000161D 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14069 0000161F B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14070 00001621 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14071                                  doblockflop:				
 14072 00001623 59                      		pop	cx
 14073                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14074 00001624 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14075 00001626 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14076 00001628 50                      		push	ax
 14077 00001629 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14078 0000162B EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14079                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14080                                  
 14081                                  doblocklast:				
 14082 0000162D 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14083 0000162F 50                      		push	ax
 14084                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14085 00001630 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14086 00001633 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14087 00001635 58                      		pop	ax
 14088 00001636 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14089                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14090 00001639 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14091 0000163B 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14092 0000163D 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14093 0000163F 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14094 00001641 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14095                                  					; then we are done already.
 14096 00001643 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14097                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14098 00001645 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14099 00001648 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14100                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14101                                  
 14102                                  bufferx:				
 14103 0000164A 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14104                                  					; set up head number
 14105                                  buffer:					
 14106 0000164D 53                      		push	bx
 14107 0000164E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14108 00001651 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14109 00001654 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14110                                  					
 14111                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14112                                  
 14113 00001656 06                      		push	es
 14114 00001657 1E                      		push	ds
 14115 00001658 56                      		push	si
 14116 00001659 57                      		push	di
 14117 0000165A 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14118 0000165B 06                      		push	es
 14119 0000165C 1F                      		pop	ds
 14120 0000165D 07                      		pop	es
 14121 0000165E BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14122 00001661 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14123 00001662 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14124 00001664 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14125 00001667 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14126                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14127 00001668 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14128 00001669 5E                      		pop	si
 14129 0000166A 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14130                                  
 14131                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14132                                  
 14133 0000166B B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14134                                  					; get drive number
 14135 0000166D 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14136 00001670 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14137                                  					;
 14138                                  					; ah is	function
 14139                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14140                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14141                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14142                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14143                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14144 00001673 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14145 00001676 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14146 00001677 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14147 00001679 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14148                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14149                                  
 14150                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14151                                  
 14152                                  doread:					
 14153 0000167B 06                      		push	es
 14154 0000167C 53                      		push	bx
 14155 0000167D 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14156 0000167E 07                      		pop	es
 14157 0000167F BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14158 00001682 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14159 00001684 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14160                                  					; get drive number
 14161 00001687 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14162                                  					; ah = function
 14163                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14164                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14165                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14166 0000168A E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14167 0000168D 5B                      		pop	bx
 14168 0000168E 07                      		pop	es
 14169 0000168F 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14170 00001691 56                      		push	si
 14171 00001692 57                      		push	di
 14172 00001693 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14173 00001695 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14174 00001698 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14175 0000169B 5F                      		pop	di
 14176 0000169C 5E                      		pop	si
 14177                                  
 14178                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14179                                  
 14180                                  dotail:					
 14181 0000169D 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14182 0000169E 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14183 000016A1 41                      		inc	cx
 14184 000016A2 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14185 000016A5 F8                      		clc
 14186 000016A6 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14187 000016A8 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14188                                  
 14189                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14190                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14191                                  
 14192 000016AA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14193 000016AD E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14194 000016B0 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14195                                  
 14196                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14197                                  
 14198                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14199                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14200                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14201                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14202                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14203                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14204                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14205                                  
 14206                                  bad13:					
 14207 000016B3 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14208 000016B5 5D                      		pop	bp
 14209 000016B6 5B                      		pop	bx
 14210 000016B7 5B                      		pop	bx
 14211 000016B8 59                      		pop	cx
 14212 000016B9 5A                      		pop	dx
 14213 000016BA 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14214 000016BC E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14215                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14216                                  
 14217                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14218 000016BF E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14219                                  
 14220                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14221                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14222                                  		;db 	0
 14223                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14224                                  
 14225                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14226

 14235                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14236 000016C2 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14237 000016C6 BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs

 14239 000016CA 07                      		pop	es

 14241                                  
 14242                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14243                                  
 14244                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14245                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14246                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14247                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14248                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14249                                  
 14250                                  install_bds:		
 14251 000016CE 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14252 000016CF BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14253                                  
 14254                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14255                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14256                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14257 000016D2 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14258                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14259 000016D4 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14260 000016D8 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14261                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14262 000016DB 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14263 000016DD B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14264 000016DF 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14265                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14266 000016E3 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14267 000016E6 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14268                                  					; we don't own it
 14269 000016EB 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14270                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14271 000016EE 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14272 000016F1 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14273                                  next_bds:				
 14274                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14275 000016F5 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14276 000016F8 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14277                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14278                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14279 000016FA 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14280 000016FC 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14281                                  					; install bds
 14282 000016FF 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14283 00001701 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14284                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14285                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14286 00001704 1F                      		pop	ds
 14287                                  
 14288                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14289                                  ;
 14290                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14291                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14292                                  ;
 14293                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14294                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14295                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14296                                  ;
 14297                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14298                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14299                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14300                                  
 14301 00001705 C3                      		retn
 14302

 14321 00001706 F606[CE08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1

 14323 0000170B 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14324

 14334 00001714 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14335                                  					; get the drive	letter

 14338                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa

 14340 00001718 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 14341 0000171A 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14342 0000171D 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14343 0000171F B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK

 14359 0000172F BE[4817]                		mov	si, SNGMSG

 14365                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 14366                                  wrmsg_loop:

 14388                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
