 15274                                  section .SYSINIT vstart=0
 15275                                  
 15276                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15277                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 15278                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15279                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 31/12/2022))
 15280                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15281                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 15282                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15283                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 15284                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15285                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit5.s -l sysinit5.lst -o SYSINIT5.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 15286                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15287                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 15288                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15289                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 15290                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 15291                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15292                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 15293                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 15294                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15295                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 15296                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 15297                                  
 15298                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15299                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15300                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 15301                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 15302                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 15303                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15304                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15305                                  
 15306                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15307                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15308                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15309                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15310                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15311                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15312                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15313                                  ;
 15314                                  ;
 15315                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15316                                  ;
 15317                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15318                                  ;
 15319                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15320                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15321                                  ;
 15322                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15323                                  ;
 15324                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15325                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15326                                  ;
 15327                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15328                                  ;
 15329                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15330                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15331                                  ;value.
 15332                                  ;
 15333                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15334                                  ;
 15335                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15336                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15337                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15338                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15339                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15340                                  ;
 15341                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15342                                  ;
 15343                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15344                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15345                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15346                                  ;
 15347                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15348                                  ;
 15349                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15350                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15351                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15352                                  ;
 15353                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15354                                  ;
 15355                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15356                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15357                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15358                                  ;
 15359                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15360                                  ;
 15361                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15362                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15363                                  ;
 15364                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15365                                  ;
 15366                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15367                                  ;
 15368                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15369                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15370                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15371                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15372                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15373                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15374                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15375                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15376                                  ;memory.
 15377                                  ;NOTES:
 15378                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15379                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15380                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15381                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15382                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15383                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15384                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15385                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15386                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15387                                  
 15388                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15389                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15390                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15391                                  
 15392                                  ;include version.inc
 15393                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15394                                  
 15395                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15396                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15397                                  
 15398                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15399                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15400                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15401                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15402                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15403                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15404                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15405                                  
 15406                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15407                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15408                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15409                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15410                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15411                                  
 15412                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15413                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15414                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15415                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15416                                  
 15417                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15418                                  
 15419                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15420                                  				; currently 0.
 15421                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15422                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15423                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15424                                  
 15425                                  ;      if1
 15426                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15427                                  ;      endif
 15428                                  
 15429                                         ;******************************
 15430                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15431                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15432                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15433                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15434                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15435                                         ;******************************
 15436                                  
 15437                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15438                                  ; device definitions
 15439                                  
 15440                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15441                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15442                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15443                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15444                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15445                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 15446                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 15447                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 15448                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 15449                                  
 15450                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 15451                                  struc	SYSDEV
 15452 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 15453 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 15454 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 15455 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 15456 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 15457                                  .size:
 15458                                  endstruc
 15459                                  
 15460                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 15461                                  struc	SRHEAD
 15462 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 15463 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 15464 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 15465 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 15466 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 15467                                  .size:
 15468                                  endstruc
 15469                                  
 15470                                  ;Status word masks
 15471                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 15472                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 15473                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 15474                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 15475                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 15476                                  
 15477                                  ;Function codes
 15478                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 15479                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 15480                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 15481                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 15482                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 15483                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 15484                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 15485                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 15486                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 15487                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 15488                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 15489                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 15490                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 15491                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 15492                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 15493                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 15494                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 15495                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 15496                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 15497                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 15498                                  
 15499                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15500                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15501 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15502 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15503 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15504 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15505 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15506 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15507                                                          ; word
 15508 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15509 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15510 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15511 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15512                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15513                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15514                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15515                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15516                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15517                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15518                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15519                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15520 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15521 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15522 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15523 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15524 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15525 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15526                                  .size:
 15527                                  endstruc
 15528                                  
 15529                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15530                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15531                                  
 15532                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15533                                  
 15534                                  struc buffinfo
 15535 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15536 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15537 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15538                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15539                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15540 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15541                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15542                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15543                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15544                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15545                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15546                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15547                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15548                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15549 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15550                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15551 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15552 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15553 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15554 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15555 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15556                                  .size:
 15557                                  endstruc
 15558                                  
 15559                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15560                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15561                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15562                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15563                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15564                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15565                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15566                                  
 15567                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15568                                  
 15569                                  
 15570                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15571                                  
 15572                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15573                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15574                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15575                                  ;***
 15576                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15577                                  ;***
 15578                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15579                                  
 15580                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15581                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15582                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15583                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15584                                  
 15585                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz
 15586                                  
 15587                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15588                                  
 15589                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15590                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15591                                  
 15592                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15593                                  
 15594                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15595                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15596                                  ;
 15597                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15598                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15599                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15600                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15601                                  ;
 15602                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15603                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15604                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15605                                  
 15606                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15607                                  
 15608                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15609                                  
 15610                                  struc	DPB
 15611 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15612 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15613 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15614 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15615 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15616 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15617 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15618 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15619 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15620 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15621                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15622 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15623 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15624 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15625 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15626 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15627                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15628 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15629 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15630 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15631                                  .size:
 15632                                  endstruc
 15633                                  
 15634                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15635                                  
 15636                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 15637

 15693                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15694                                  
 15695                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15696                                  ;
 15697                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15698                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15699                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15700                                  ;
 15701                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15702                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15703                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15704                                  ;
 15705                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15706                                  
 15707                                  struc A_BPB
 15708 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15709 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15710 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15711 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15712 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15713 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15714 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15715 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15716 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15717 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15718 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15719 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15720 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15721 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15722 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15723                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15724                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15725                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15726                                  .size:
 15727                                  endstruc
 15728

 15733 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15734 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15735 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 15736 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 15737 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 15738                                  endstruc

 15986                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15987                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15988                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15989                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15990                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15991                                  									  
 15992                                  ;*******************************					  
 15993                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15994                                  ;*******************************					  
 15995                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15996                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15997                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15998                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15999                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16000                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16001                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16002                                  ;For all others:							  
 16003                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16004                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16005                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16006                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16007                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16008                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16009                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16010                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16011                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16012                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16013                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16014                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16015                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16016                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16017                                  ;									  
 16018                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16019                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16020                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16021                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16022                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16023                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16024                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16025                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16026                                  ;									  
 16027                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16028                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16029                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16030                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16031                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16032                                  ;									  
 16033                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16034                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16035                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16036                                  ;									  
 16037                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16038                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16039                                  ;									  
 16040                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16041                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16042                                  ;									  
 16043                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16044                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16045                                  ;						(Int 09h).

 16177                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16178                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16179                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16180                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16181                                  
 16182                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16183                                  ;
 16184                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16185                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16186                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16187                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16188                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16189                                  ;
 16190                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16191                                  ;
 16192                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16193                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16194                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16195                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16196                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16197                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16198                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16199                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16200                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16201                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16202                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16203                                  
 16204                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16205                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16206                                  
 16207                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16208                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16209 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16210 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16211 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16212 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16213 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16214 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16215                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16216 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16217 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16218 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16219                                  .size:
 16220                                  endstruc
 16221                                  
 16222                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16223                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16224                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16225                                  						; argument
 16226                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 16227                                  
 16228                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 16229                                  
 16230                                  ;Flag word masks
 16231                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16232                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16233                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 16234                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 16235                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 16237                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16238                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16239                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16240                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16241                                  
 16242                                  ; system file table
 16243                                  
 16244                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16245                                  ;
 16246                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16247                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16248                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16249                                  
 16250                                  struc	SF
 16251 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16252 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16253 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16254                                  .size:
 16255                                  endstruc
 16256                                  
 16257                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16258                                  ;
 16259                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16260                                  
 16261                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16262 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16263                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16264 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16265 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16266 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16267                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16268                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16269                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16270                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16271                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16272                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16273                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16274                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16275                                  					;
 16276                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16277                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16278                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16279                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16280                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16281                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16282                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16283                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16284                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16285                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16286                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16287                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16288 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16289                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16290                                  					; points to net device header if
 16291                                  					; remote
 16292 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16293                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16294 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16295 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16296 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16297 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16298                                  ;
 16299                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16300                                  ; ID
 16301                                  ;
 16302 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16303 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16304 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 16305                                  ;
 16306                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 16307                                  ;
 16308 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 16309                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 16310                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 16311                                  					; disk changed errors.
 16312                                  ; SHARING INFO
 16313 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 16314 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 16315 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 16316 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 16317 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 16318 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 16319                                  .size:
 16320                                  endstruc

 16487                                  RE_INIT		equ 089Bh ; (re_init offset in DOSBIODATASEG)
 16488                                  
 16489                                  %endif

 16593                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 16599                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16600                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16601                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16602                                  
 16603                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16604                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16605                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16606                                  
 16607                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16608                                  ;
 16609                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16610                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16611                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16612                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16613                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16614                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16615                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16616                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16617                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16618                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16619                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16620                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16621                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16622                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16623                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16624                                  ;
 16625                                  
 16626                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16627                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16628                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16629                                  ;
 16630                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16631                                  ;
 16632                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16633                                  ;
 16634                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16635                                  ;
 16636                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16637                                  ;
 16638                                  
 16639                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16640                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16641                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16642                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16643                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16644                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16645                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16646                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16647                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16648                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16649                                  
 16650                                  		;EVEN
 16651                                  ;align 2
 16652                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16653                                  
 16654 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16655 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16656 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16657 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16658 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16659 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16660                                  
 16661 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16662 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16663 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16664                                  
 16665                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16666                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16667                                  
 16668                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16669                                  
 16670 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16671                                  
 16672                                  int02:
 16673                                  
 16674                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16675                                  ;
 16676                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16677                                  ;
 16678                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16679                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16680                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16681                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16682                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16683                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16684                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16685                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16686                                  ;
 16687                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16688                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16689                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16690                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16691                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16692                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16693                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16694                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16695                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16696                                  ;
 16697                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16698                                  
 16699 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16700 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16701 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16702 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16703                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16704 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16705 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16706 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16707                                  
 16708 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16709                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16710                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16711                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16712                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16713 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16714 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02

 16949                                  ;********************************************************************
 16950                                  ;common routines
 16951                                  ;********************************************************************
 16952                                  
 16953                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16954                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16955                                  ; service routine
 16956                                  
 16957                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16958                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16959                                  
 16960                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16961                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16962                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16963                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16964                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16965                                  
 16966                                  do_int_stacks:
 16967 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16968 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16969 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16970 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16971 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16972 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16973                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16974                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16975                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16976 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16977 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16978 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16979                                  
 16980 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16981                                  
 16982                                  found02:
 16983 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16984 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16985                                  
 16986 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16987                                  
 16988 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16989                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16990                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16991                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16992                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16993 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16994 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16995                                  
 16996                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16997                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16998                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16999                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 17000                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 17001                                  	;mov	sp,es
 17002                                  	;mov	es,ax
 17003                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 17004                                  
 17005                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 17006 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 17007 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 17008 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 17009 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 17010 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 17011 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 17012 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 17013 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 17014                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17015                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 17016 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 17017                                  
 17018 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 17019                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17020 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 17021                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17022                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17023                                  
 17024 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17025                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17026 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 17027                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17028                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17029 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17030 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17031                                  
 17032                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17033                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry

 18303                                  	; ds = cs (at return from doconf)
 18304                                  
 18305                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18306                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18307                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18308                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18309                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18310                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18311                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18312                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18313                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18314                                  ;
 18315                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18316                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18317                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18318                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18319                                  ; been patched.
 18320                                  
 18321                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18322                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0749h)
 18323                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:runhigh],0	; Did user choose to run low ?
 18324                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18325 0000071D 803E[6A02]00            	cmp	byte [runhigh],0
 18326 00000722 740C                    	je	short dont_install_stub	; yes, don't install dos low mem stub
 18327                                  
 18328                                  ;------ user chose to load high
 18329                                  
 18330                                  	; 22/10/2022

 18605 000007DD BA[1D34]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18606                                  
 18607                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18608                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18609                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18610                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18611                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18612                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18613                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18614                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18615                                  
 18616                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18617                                  
 18618 000007E0 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name

 18629 000007F4 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx

 18631                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18632                                  
 18633                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18634                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18635                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18636                                  
 18637                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18638                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 18640 000007FA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18641                                  
 18642                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18643                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18644                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18645                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18646                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18647                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18648                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18649                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18650                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18651                                  ;
 18652                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18653                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18654                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18655                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18656                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18657                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18658                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP

 18907                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18908                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 18909                                  ;
 18910                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 18911                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 18912                                  ;
 18913                                  ; Inputs : None
 18914                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 18915                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 18916                                  ;	   free memory.
 18917                                  ;
 18918                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 18919                                  ;
 18920                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18921                                  
 18922                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18923                                  AllocFreeMem:
 18924 00000855 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 18925 00000858 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 18926 0000085A CD21                    	int	21h			; first time fails
 18927 0000085C B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 18928 0000085E CD21                    	int	21h			; second time gets it
 18929                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18930                                  	; ds = cs
 18931                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 18932                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to
 18933 00000860 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax
 18934 00000863 A3[E003]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 18935 00000866 C3                      	retn				; start of free memory
 18936                                  				
 18937                                  	; include msbio.cl6
 18938                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 18945                                  ;
 18946                                  ; procedure : LoadDOSHiOrLo
 18947                                  ;
 18948                                  ;		Tries to move DOS into HMA. If it fails then loads
 18949                                  ;		DOS into Low memory. For ROMDOS, nothing is actually
 18950                                  ;		moved; this just tries to allocate the HMA, and prints
 18951                                  ;		a message if this is not possible.
 18952                                  ;
 18953                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18954                                  
 18955                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18956                                  LoadDOSHiOrLo:
 18957                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18958                                  	; ds = cs
 18959 000008BA E81F00                  	call	TryToMovDOSHi		; Try moving it into HMA (M024)
 18960                                  	;jc	short LdngLo		; If that don't work...
 18961                                  	;retn
 18962                                  	; 18/12/2022
 18963 000008BD 731C                    	jnc	short LoadDosHi_ok
 18964                                  LdngLo:
 18965                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18966                                  	;push	cs
 18967                                  	;pop	ds
 18968                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18969                                  	; ds = cs
 18970 000008BF B409                    	mov	ah,9
 18971 000008C1 BA[6708]                	mov	dx,DOSLOMSG		; inform user that we are
 18972 000008C4 CD21                    	int	21h			; loading low
 18973                                  
 18974                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18975                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.
 18976

 18978                                  						;  use int 21 alloc for mem
 18979 000008C9 E83F00                  	call	MovDOSLo
 18980                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18981                                  	; ds = cs
 18982                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]	; give dos its temporary loc.
 18983                                  	; 23/10/2022

 18985                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION]  ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18986                                  	;mov	es,[FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 27/03/2019

 18988                                  	; 11/12/2022

 19003                                  ;
 19004                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19005                                  ;
 19006                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19007                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19008                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19009                                  ;
 19010                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19011                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19012                                  ; 
 19013                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19014                                  
 19015                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19016                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 19017                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 19018                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19019                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19020                                  	; ds = cs
 19021 000008DC E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 19022 000008DF 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 19023                                  
 19024                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19025                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19026                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 19027                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19028                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19029                                  	; ds = cs
 19030 000008E1 8E06[7102]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 19031                                  ;else
 19032                                  ;	..
 19033                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19034                                  
 19035                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19036                                  	; ds = cs
 19037 000008E5 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 19038                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 19039 000008E7 FF1E[7B02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 19040                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 19041 000008EB C606[6A02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 19042 000008F0 F8                      	clc
 19043                                  ttldhx:
 19044 000008F1 C3                      	retn

 19047                                  ;
 19048                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19049                                  ;
 19050                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19051                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19052                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19053                                  ;
 19054                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 19055                                  ;
 19056                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19057                                  
 19058                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19059                                  MovDOSHi:
 19060                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19061                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19062                                  	; ds = cs
 19063 000008F2 E8D800                  	call	AllocHMA
 19064 000008F5 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 19065 000008F7 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 19066 000008FA 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19067                                  
 19068                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19069                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 19070                                  
 19071                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 19072                                  	; 24/03/2019
 19073                                  	
 19074                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19075 000008FC E83400                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 19076                                  
 19077                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 19078                                  	
 19079                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19080                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19081                                  	;xor	di,di
 19082                                  	
 19083                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19084                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 19085                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19086                                  	; ds = cs
 19087 000008FF 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 19088 00000903 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 19089                                  
 19090                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 19091                                  ;else
 19092                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 19093                                  ;
 19094                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 19095                                  ;
 19096                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19097                                  
 19098 00000906 E86202                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 19099 00000909 F8                      	clc
 19100                                  mdhx:
 19101 0000090A C3                      	retn
