 19421                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19422                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19423                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19424                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19425                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19426                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19427                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19428                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19429                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19430                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19431                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19432                                  ;
 19433                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19434                                  
 19435                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19436                                  update_arena:
 19437 00000986 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19438 00000987 57                      	push	di
 19439 00000988 51                      	push	cx
 19440 00000989 52                      	push	dx
 19441                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19442                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19443                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19444                                  	; ds = cs 
 19445 0000098A C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19446 0000098E 4F                      	dec	di
 19447 0000098F 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19448                                  						;  before sysvar
 19449 00000990 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19450                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19451 00000992 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19452 00000997 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19453 00000999 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19454                                  
 19455                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19456 0000099B 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19457 000009A0 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19458 000009A2 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19459 000009A4 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19460 000009A6 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19461                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19462 000009A8 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19463                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19464 000009AC C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0

 19467 000009B4 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19468 000009B8 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller

 19498                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19499                                  ;
 19500                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19501                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19502                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19503                                  ;
 19504                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19505                                  ;
 19506                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19507                                  
 19508                                  AllocHMA:
 19509                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19510                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19511                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19512                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19513                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.

 19515                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19516                                  ;

 19518                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19519                                  ;	push	ax
 19520                                  ;	popf
 19521                                  ;	pushf
 19522                                  ;	pop	ax
 19523                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)

 19667                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19668                                  ;
 19669                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19670                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19671                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19672                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19673                                  ;
 19674                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19675                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19676                                  ;
 19677                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19678                                  
 19679                                  StartVDHead:
 19680                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19681                                  
 19682 00000A45 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19683 00000A49 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19684 00000A4B 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19685 00000A4D 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19686 00000A4F 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19687                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19688 00000A50 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19689                                  VDiskSig1:
 19690 00000A57 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19691                                  
 19692                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19693                                  
 19694 00000A5C 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19695                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19696 00000A62 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19697 00000A71 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19698 00000A73 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19699                                  VDInt19:
 19700 00000A74 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19701                                  OldVDInt19:
 19702 00000A75 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19703                                  
 19704                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19705                                  
 19706                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19707 00000A79 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19708                                  VDiskSig2:
 19709 00000A7C 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19710                                  
 19711                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19712                                  
 19713 00000A81 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19714 00000A84 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19715 00000A86 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19716 00000A87 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19717 00000A89 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19718 00000A8A 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19719 00000A8C 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19720 00000A8E FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19721 00000A8F 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19722 00000A91 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19723 00000A93 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19724 00000A95 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19725 00000A97 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)

 19731                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19732                                  ;
 19733                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19734                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19735                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19736                                  ;
 19737                                  ; Inputs : None
 19738                                  ;
 19739                                  ; Outputs : None
 19740                                  ;
 19741                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19742                                  ;
 19743                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19744                                  
 19745                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19746                                  
 19747                                  InstVDiskHeader:

 19749 00000A9B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table

 19758                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19759 00000AA7 2EA3[770A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19760                                  
 19761                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19762

 19764                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19765                                  	; 23/10/2022

 19768                                  
 19769                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19770                                  
 19771 00000AB2 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena

 19781

 19864                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19865                                  
 19866                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19867                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19868                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19869                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19870                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19871                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19872                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19873                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19874                                  ;								      ;I070
 19875                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19876                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19877                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19878                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19879                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19880                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19881                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19882                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19883                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19884                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19885                                  ;								      ;I070
 19886                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19887                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19888                                  
 19889                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19890                                  	; ds = cs

 19925                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19926                                  ;
 19927                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19928                                  ;
 19929                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19930                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19931                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19932                                  ;		the offset.
 19933                                  ;
 19934                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 19935                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 19936                                  ;
 19937                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19938                                  
 19939                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 19940 00000B6B 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 19941 00000B6D B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 19942 00000B70 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 19943 00000B72 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 19944 00000B75 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 19945 00000B78 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19946 00000B7A D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19947 00000B7C 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 19948 00000B7E 1E                      	push	ds
 19949                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 19950                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 19951                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19952 00000B7F B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 19953 00000B82 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19954 00000B84 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19955 00000B88 C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 19956 00000B8D 1F                      	pop	ds
 19957 00000B8E C3                      	retn

 19996                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19997                                  ;
 19998                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 19999                                  ;
 20000                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20001                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20002                                  ;
 20003                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20004                                  
 20005                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20006                                  CPMHack:
 20007 00000BB7 1E                      	push	ds
 20008 00000BB8 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20009 00000BBB 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20010                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20011                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20012 00000BBD 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20013 00000BBE 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20014 00000BC0 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20015 00000BC3 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20016                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20017 00000BC6 B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20018 00000BC8 FC                      	cld
 20019 00000BC9 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20020 00000BCB 1F                      	pop	ds
 20021 00000BCC C3                      	retn

 20885                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20886                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20887                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20888                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20889                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20890                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20891                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20892                                  ;
 20893                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20894                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20895                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20896                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20897                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20898                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20899                                  ;
 20900                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20901                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20902                                  ;
 20903                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20904                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20905                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20906                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20907                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20908                                  ;
 20909                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20910                                  ;
 20911                                  ;			  none.
 20912                                  
 20913                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20914                                  ;
 20915                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20916                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20917                                  
 20918                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20919                                  
 20920 00000F58 50                      	push	ax

 21119                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21120                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21121                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21122                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21123                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21124                                  ;
 21125                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21126                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21127                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21128                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21129                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21130                                  ; program).
 21131                                  
 21132                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21133                                  
 21134                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21135                                  
 21136 00001040 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21137                                  
 21138                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21139                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21140                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21141                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21142                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21143                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21144                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21145                                  ; carridge return.
 21146                                  
 21147                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21148                                  ;character after =.
 21149                                  
 21150 00001041 06                      	push	es
 21151 00001042 1E                      	push	ds
 21152 00001043 07                      	pop	es
 21153 00001044 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21154 00001045 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21155                                  
 21156 00001047 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21157 00001049 FC                      	cld
 21158 0000104A 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21159 00001050 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21160                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21161 00001053 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21162 00001054 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21163 00001056 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21164 00001058 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21165                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21166 0000105A AC                      	lodsb
 21167 0000105B 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21168 0000105E 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21169 00001060 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21170 00001062 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21171 00001064 47                      	inc	di
 21172 00001065 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21173                                  done_installparm:
 21174 00001067 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21175 0000106C 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21176 0000106F 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21177 00001071 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21178                                  					; starts with cr.
 21179                                  install_seg_set:
 21180 00001077 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21181 0000107E 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 21182

 21186                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.

 21214                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 21215 00001084 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 21216                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21217 00001088 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21218                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21219 0000108C 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21220 00001090 E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 21221 00001093 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 21222 00001097 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21223 00001099 B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 21224 0000109B BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 21225 0000109E 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 21226 0000109F 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 21227 000010A0 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 21228                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 21229                                  
 21230                                  ;----------------------------------------
 21231                                  
 21232                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 21233                                  
 21234                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 21235                                  
 21236                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 21237 000010A5 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 21238 000010A6 06                      	push	es
 21239 000010A7 1E                      	push	ds
 21240 000010A8 07                      	pop	es

 21242 000010AA 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 21243                                  
 21244 000010AC 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 21245 000010AD E86F22                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 21246 000010B0 5E                      	pop	si

 21261 000010B6 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3

 21269                                  
 21270                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21271                                  ;
 21272                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21273                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21274                                  ;
 21275                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21276                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21277                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21278                                  
 21279                                  ParaRound:
 21280 000010C0 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21281 000010C3 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21282 000010C5 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21283 000010C7 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21284 000010C9 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21285 000010CB C3                      	retn
 21286                                  
 21287                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21288                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21289                                  ;
 21290                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21291                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21292                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21293                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21294                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21295                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21296                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21297                                  ;
 21298                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21299                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21300                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21301                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21302                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21303                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21304                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21305                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21306                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21307                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21308                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21309                                  ;
 21310                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21311                                  
 21312                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21313                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21314                                  sysinit_base:				
 21315 000010CC 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21316 000010D1 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21317 000010D6 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21318 000010D8 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21319 000010DD 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21320 000010E2 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21321 000010E3 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21322 000010E4 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21323                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21324                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21325 000010E6 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21326 000010E9 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21327 000010EE 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21328                                  
 21329                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21330                                  
 21331 000010F0 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21332 000010F2 0E                      	push	cs
 21333 000010F3 1F                      	pop	ds
 21334 000010F4 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21335 000010F7 CD21                    	int	21h
 21336                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21337                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21338                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21339                                  _stall: 
 21340                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21341 000010F9 F4                      	hlt 
 21342                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21343                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21344 000010FA EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21345                                  
 21346                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21347 000010FC 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21348                                  
 21349                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21350                                  
 21351                                  sum_up:
 21352                                  
 21353                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21354                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21355                                  ;
 21356                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21357                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21358                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21359                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21360                                  ;
 21361                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21362                                  
 21363 00001101 1E                      	push	ds
 21364                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21365                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21366 00001102 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21367 00001106 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21368 00001108 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21369 0000110A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21370 0000110C 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21371                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21372 00001111 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21373 00001113 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21374                                  sum1:
 21375 00001115 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21376 00001117 46                      	inc	si
 21377 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21378 00001119 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21379                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21380                                  sum_sys_code:
 21381                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21382 0000111B BE1A11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21383                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21384                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21385                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21386                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21387                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21388                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21389                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21390 0000111E B9[B038]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21391 00001121 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21392 00001123 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21393                                  sum2:
 21394 00001125 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21395 00001128 46                      	inc	si
 21396 00001129 46                      	inc	si
 21397 0000112A E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21398 0000112C 1F                      	pop	ds
 21399 0000112D C3                      	retn
 21400                                  
 21401                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21402                                  
 21403                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21404                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21405 0000112E 0000                    	dw	0
 21406                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21407                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 21408 00001130 0000                    	dw	0

 21423                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21424                                  ;
 21425                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21426                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21427                                  ;
 21428                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21429                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21430                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21431                                  ;
 21432                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21433                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21434                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 21444                                  set_buff_1:

 21447 00001156 893F                    	mov	[bx],di

 21449 00001158 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es

 21451 0000115B C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0

 21453 00001160 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21454 00001162 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]

 21456

 21463

 21475 00001180 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21476                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21477 00001182 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21478 00001186 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21479                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21480 0000118A C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0

 21482 0000118F 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax

 21484                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21485 00001196 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21486                                  set_buff_2:
 21487 00001199 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax

 21489 0000119E 2E800E[3414]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 21495                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21496                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21497                                  ;
 21498                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21499                                  ;
 21500                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21501                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21502                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 21504                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21505                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21506 000011A7 53                      	push	bx
 21507 000011A8 52                      	push	dx
 21508 000011A9 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21509 000011AD 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21510                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21511 000011B2 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21512                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21513                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21514                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21515 000011B5 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21516 000011B7 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21517 000011B9 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21518                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21519 000011BC CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21520 000011BE 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21521 000011C1 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21522 000011C3 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21523                                  	;zf=1
 21524                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21525                                  	;zf=1
 21526 000011C6 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21527                                  got_hma:
 21528 000011CB 5A                      	pop	dx
 21529 000011CC 5B                      	pop	bx
 21530 000011CD C3                      	retn

 21553 000011E3 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh

 21555 000011E9 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21556                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21557 000011EF 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0

 21559                                  
 21560                                  ; ======================================================================
 21561                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21562                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21563                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21564                                  
 21565                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21566                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21567                                  ;
 21568                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21569                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21570                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21571                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21572                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21573                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21574                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21575                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21576                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21577                                  ;
 21578                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21579                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21580                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21581                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21582                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21583                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21584                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21585                                  ;	conditions:
 21586                                  ;
 21587                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21588                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21589                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21590                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21591                                  ;
 21592                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21593                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21594                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21595                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21596                                  ;
 21597                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21598                                  ;
 21599                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21600                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21601                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21602                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21603                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21604                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21605                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21606                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21607                                  ;
 21608                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21609                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21610                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21611                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21612                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21613                                  ;
 21614                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21615                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21616                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21617                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21618                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21619                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21620                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21621                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21622                                  ;
 21623                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21624                                  
 21625                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21626                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21627                                  
 21628                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21629                                  stackinit:
 21630 000011F6 50                      	push	ax
 21631 000011F7 1E                      	push	ds
 21632 000011F8 06                      	push	es
 21633 000011F9 53                      	push	bx
 21634 000011FA 51                      	push	cx
 21635 000011FB 52                      	push	dx
 21636 000011FC 57                      	push	di
 21637 000011FD 56                      	push	si
 21638 000011FE 55                      	push	bp
 21639                                  
 21640                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21641                                  
 21642                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21643                                  	; ds = cs
 21644 000011FF A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21645 00001202 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21646                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21647                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21648                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21649 00001204 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21650                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21651 00001208 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21652 0000120B 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21653                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21654 0000120F A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21655                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 21708                                  ;  cx = number of entries

 22462                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22463                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22464                                  
 22465                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22466                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22467                                  
 22468                                  new_init_loop:
 22469                                  
 22470                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22471                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22472                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22473                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22474                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22475                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22476                                  
 22477 000013EA 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22478 000013ED 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22479 000013EF 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22480 000013F3 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22481                                  
 22482 000013F6 1E                      	push	ds
 22483                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22484                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22485                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22486 000013F7 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22487 000013FA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22488 000013FC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22489 000013FF 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22490 00001401 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22491 00001405 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22492 00001408 1F                      	pop	ds
 22493                                  
 22494 00001409 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22495 0000140C 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22496 00001410 C3                      	retn
 22497                                  
 22498                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22499                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22500                                  
 22501                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22502                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22503                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22504                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22505                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22506                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22507                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22508                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22509                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22510                                  
 22511                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22512                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22513                                  
 22514                                  setdevmark:
 22515                                  
 22516 00001411 06                      	push	es
 22517 00001412 51                      	push	cx
 22518                                  
 22519 00001413 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22520 00001418 2E890E[3214]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22521 0000141D 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22522                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22523                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22524 0000141F 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22525 00001423 41                      	inc	cx
 22526                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22527 00001424 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22528                                  
 22529 00001429 59                      	pop	cx
 22530 0000142A 07                      	pop	es
 22531 0000142B 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22532 00001430 C3                      	retn

 22735                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)

 22740                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22741                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22742                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22743                                  
 22744                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22745                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22746 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22747 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22748 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22749                                  endstruc
 22750                                  
 22751                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 22752                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 22753                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22754                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22755                                  
 22756                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22757                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22758                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22759                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22760                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22761                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22762                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22763                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22764                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22765                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22766                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22767                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22768                                  
 22769                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22770                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22771 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22772 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22773 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22774                                  endstruc
 22775                                  
 22776                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22777                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22778                                  ;
 22779                                  ;
 22780                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22781                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22782                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22783                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22784                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22785                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22786                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22787                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22788                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22789                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22790                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22791                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22792                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22793                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22794                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22795                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22796                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22797                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22798                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22799                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22800                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22801                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22802                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22803                                  ;	   :
 22804                                  ;
 22805                                  ;Note:
 22806                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22807                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22808                                  ;
 22809                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22810                                  ;
 22811                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22812                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22813                                  ;
 22814                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22815                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22816                                  ;
 22817                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22818                                  ;
 22819                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22820                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22821                                  ;
 22822                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22823                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22824                                  ;
 22825                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22826                                  ;
 22827                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22828                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22829                                  ;
 22830                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22831                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22832                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22833                                  ;
 22834                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22835                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22836                                  ;
 22837                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22838                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22839                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22840                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22841                                  
 22842                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22843                                  
 22844                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22845                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22846                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22847                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22848                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22849                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22850                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22851                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22852                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22853                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22854                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22855                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22856                                  
 22857                                  ;**** Function flags
 22858                                  
 22859                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22860                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22861                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22862                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22863                                  
 22864                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22865                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22866 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22867 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22868 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22869 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22870 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22871 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22872                                  endstruc
 22873                                  
 22874                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22875                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22876                                  ;
 22877                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22878                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22879                                  ;	     +-
 22880                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22881                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22882                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22883                                  ;	     |	:
 22884                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22885                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22886                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22887                                  ;	     |	:
 22888                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22889                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22890                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22891                                  ;	     +-	:
 22892                                  ;
 22893                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22894                                  ;
 22895                                  ;Note:
 22896                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22897                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22898                                  ;
 22899                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22900                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22901                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22902                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22903                                  
 22904                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22905                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22906                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22907                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22908                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22909                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22910                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22911                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22912                                  
 22913                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22914 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22915 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22916 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22917 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22918 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22919                                  endstruc
 22920                                  
 22921                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22922                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22923                                  ;
 22924                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22925                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22926                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22927                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22928                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22929                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22930                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22931                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22932                                  ;
 22933                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22934                                  ;
 22935                                  ;            +-
 22936                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22937                                  ;	    | or
 22938                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22939                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22940                                  ;	    | or
 22941                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22942                                  ;	    | or
 22943                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22944                                  ;	    | or
 22945                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22946                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22947                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22948                                  ;	    | or
 22949                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22950                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22951                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22952                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22953                                  ;	    +-
 22954                                  ;
 22955                                  ;
 22956                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22957                                  ;      list.
 22958                                  ;
 22959                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22960                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22961                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22962                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22963                                  
 22964                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22965                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22966 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22967 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22968 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22969 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22970                                  endstruc
 22971                                  
 22972                                  ;--------------------------------
 22973                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 22974                                  
 22975                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 22976                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number
 22977                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 22978                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 22979                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 22980                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 22981                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 22982                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 22983                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 22984                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 22985                                  
 22986                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 22987                                  
 22988                                  ;**** Return code
 22989                                  ;
 22990                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 22991                                  
 22992                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 22993                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 22994                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 22995                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 22996                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22997                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22998                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22999                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23000                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23001                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line
 23002

 23081                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
