 23083                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23084                                  
 23085                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23086                                  ; SysParse;
 23087                                  ;
 23088                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23089                                  ;
 23090                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23091                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23092                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23093                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23094                                  ;
 23095                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23096                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23097                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23098                                  ;
 23099                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23100                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23101                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23102                                  ;
 23103                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23104                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23105                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23106                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23107                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23108                                  ;
 23109                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23110                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23111                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23112                                  ;
 23113                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23114                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23115                                  ;
 23116                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23117                                  ;
 23118                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23119                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23120                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23121                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23122                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23123                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23124                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23125                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23126                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23127                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23128                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23129                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23130                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23131                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23132                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23133                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23134                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23135                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23136                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23137                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23138                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23139                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23140                                  ;					  (tm12)

 23720                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23721                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23722                                  ;
 23723                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23724                                  ;
 23725                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23726                                  ;	    AL = type
 23727                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23728                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23729                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23730                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23731                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23732                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths

 23734                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23735                                  ;
 23736                                  ; Output:   None
 23737                                  ;
 23738                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM

 23740                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)

 23828                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23829                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 23830                                  ;
 23831                                  ; Function:  Check the mutch_flags and make the exit code and set the
 23832                                  ;	     result buffer
 23833                                  ;
 23834                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 23835                                  ;		Complex
 23836                                  ;		Date
 23837                                  ;		Time
 23838                                  ;		Drive
 23839                                  ;		Filespec
 23840                                  ;		Quoted String
 23841                                  ;		Simple String
 23842                                  ;
 23843                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23844                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23845                                  ;
 23846                                  ; Output:    None
 23847                                  ;
 23848                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format
 23849                                  ;	     _$P_Time_Format, _$P_Complex_Format, _$P_File_Foemat

 23853                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0

 23862 000017A1 268B07                  	mov	ax,[es:bx]		;AN000; load match flag(16bit) to ax

 24130                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24131                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24132                                  ;
 24133                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24134                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24135                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24136                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24137                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24138                                  ;
 24139                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24140                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24141                                  ;
 24142                                  ; Output:    None
 24143                                  ;
 24144                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24145                                  ;
 24146                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24147                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24148                                  
 24149                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24150                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24151                                  
 24152                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24153 000018C9 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24154 000018CA 2E800E[4714]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24155 000018D0 2E8026[4714]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24156 000018D6 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24157 000018D9 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24158 000018DB 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24159                                  
 24160 000018DD 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24161 000018DF 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24162                                  
 24163 000018E1 2E800E[4714]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24164                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24165 000018E7 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24166                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24167 000018E8 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value

 25109                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25110                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25111                                  ;
 25112                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25113                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25114                                  ;
 25115                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25116                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25117                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25118                                  ;
 25119                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25120                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25121                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25122                                  
 25123                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25124                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25125                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25126                                  ;
 25127                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25128                                  
 25129                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25130                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25131                                  
 25132                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25133                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25134                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25135                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25136 00001C63 BD[5014]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25137                                  
 25138                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25139 00001C66 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25140 00001C68 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25141                                  
 25142                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25143 00001C6A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25144 00001C6C 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25145                                  
 25146 00001C6E F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25147                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25148                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25149 00001C6F C3                      	retn
 25150                                  
 25151                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25152                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25153                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25154                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25155                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25156                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25157                                  
 25158                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25159                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25160 00001C70 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25161 00001C72 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25162                                  
 25163 00001C74 2E800E[4714]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25164                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25165                                  
 25166                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25167                                  	; cf=0
 25168                                  	;retn
 25169                                  
 25170                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25171                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25172                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25173 00001C7A F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25174                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25175                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25176 00001C7B C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25178                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25179                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25180                                  ;
 25181                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25182                                  ;
 25183                                  ;  Input:
 25184                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25185                                  ;
 25186                                  ;  Output:
 25187                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25188                                  ;
 25189                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25190                                  ;
 25191                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25192                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25193                                  
 25194                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25195 00001C7C 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25196 00001C7D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25197 00001C7E 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)

 25202 00001C84 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25203 00001C86 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25204 00001C88 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25205 00001C89 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25206 00001C8A 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25207 00001C8B 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25208 00001C8C 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25209 00001C8D 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25210 00001C8E 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25211                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 25212                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;

 25215 00001C94 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25216                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25217 00001C96 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25218 00001C98 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25219 00001C9A 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25220 00001C9B 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25221 00001C9C 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25222 00001C9D 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25223 00001C9E 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25224 00001C9F 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25225 00001CA0 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25226 00001CA1 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25227                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25228 00001CA3 2E8936[4214]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25229 00001CA8 2E891E[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25230                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25231                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset

 25235                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25236 00001CB2 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25237 00001CB5 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25238 00001CB7 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25239 00001CB9 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25240 00001CBB 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25241 00001CBE 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25242 00001CC0 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit

 25244                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;

 25246 00001CC4 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25247                                  					;AN000; get next vector

 25810                                  
 25811                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25812                                  
 25813                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25814                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25815                                  
 25816                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25817                                  ;
 25818                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25819                                  ;
 25820                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25821                                  ;
 25822                                  ;   Modification log:
 25823                                  ;
 25824                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25825                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25826                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25827                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25828                                  ;
 25829                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25830                                  ;
 25831                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25832                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25833                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25834                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25835                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25836                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25837                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25838                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25839                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25840                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25841                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25842                                  ;
 25843                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25844                                  
 25845                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25846                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25847                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25848                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25849                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25850                                  
 25851                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25852                                  
 25853                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25854                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25855                                  
 25856                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25857                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25858                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25859                                  
 25860                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25861                                  ;
 25862                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25863                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25864                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25865                                  ;	           line.
 25866                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25867                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25868                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25869                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25870                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25871                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25872                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25873                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25874                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25875                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25876                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25877                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25878                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25879                                  ;	           for details).
 25880                                  
 25881                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25882                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25883                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25884                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25885                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25886                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25887                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25888                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25889                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25890                                  
 25891                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25892                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25893                                  
 25894                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25895                                  
 25896                                  %endif
 25897                                  
 25898                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 25899                                  
 25900                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 25901                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 25902                                  
 25903                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25904                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 25905                                  
 25906                                  		;public	DevEntry
 25907                                  
 25908 00001EAE 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25909 00001EB0 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25910 00001EB2 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25911 00001EB4 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25912 00001EB8 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25913                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25914                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25915                                  ;
 25916 00001EBC 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25917 00001EBD 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25918 00001EBF 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25919 00001EC1 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25920                                  ;
 25921 00001EC3 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 25922                                  ;
 25923 00001EC7 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 25924 00001EC9 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 25925                                  ;
 25926 00001ECB 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 25927                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 25928 00001ECC 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 25929                                  ;
 25930 00001ECE 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 25931 00001ECF 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 25932 00001ED1 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 25933                                  ;
 25934 00001ED9 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 25935 00001EDA 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data
 25936 00001EDC 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 25937 00001EE0 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 25938                                  				; to use the file name in the command line
 25939                                  ;
 25940                                  ;	ifdef	dblspace_hooks
 25941                                  ;MagicHomeFlag:	db	0	; set non-zero when MagicDrv is final placed
 25942                                  ;	endif
 25943

 26053

 26061 00001F4C 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted

 26103                                  conferr:

 26119 00001F74 0E                      	push	cs

 26122 00001F76 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10

 26145

 26147                                  
 26148 00001FA5 C606[3114]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26149 00001FAA C606[3414]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26150 00001FAF 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 26151 00001FB1 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 26152                                  
 26153                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26154                                  %if 0
 26155                                  
 26156                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26157                                  
 26158                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26159                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26160                                  
 26161                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26162                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26163                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26164                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26165                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26166                                  
 26167                                          push    ax                      ;
 26168                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26169                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26170                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26171                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26172                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26173                                          pop     ax
 26174                                  ;
 26175                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26176                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26177                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26178                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26179                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26180                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26181                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26182                                  ;   spot.
 26183                                  ;
 26184                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26185                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26186                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26187                                  ;   retrieved.
 26188                                  ;
 26189                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26190                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26191                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26192                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26193                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26194                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26195                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26196                                  final:                                  ;
 26197                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26198                                  not_final:                              ;
 26199                                  ;endif
 26200                                  
 26201                                  %endif
 26202 00001FB3 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26203 00001FB5 E84707                  	call	getchr
 26204 00001FB8 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26205                                  
 26206 00001FBA 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2

 26208                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26209 00001FBF 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26210 00001FC1 E90707                  	jmp	badop
 26211                                  	
 26212                                  coff:	
 26213                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26214                                  	; ds = cs

 26225                                  ; 11/12/2022

 26228                                  	;push	cs
 26229                                  	;pop	ds

 26231                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26232                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26233                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26234                                  ;install= command.

 26237                                  ;install command
 26238                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26239                                  
 26240                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26241                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26242                                  tryi:
 26243 00001FCE 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 26244 00001FD3 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 26245 00001FD5 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 26246                                  not_init_pass:
 26247 00001FD8 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 26248                                          ; 11/12/2022
 26249                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 26250 00001FDD 74E5                    	je	short coff
 26251                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26252                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26253                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 26254                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 26255                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 26256                                  					; and before install= commands
 26257                                  					; are processed
 26258                                  
 26259 00001FDF 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 26260 00001FE4 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 26261 00001FE6 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 26262                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26263                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 26264 00001FE9 74D9                    	je	short coff
 26265                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26266                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 26267                                  
 26268                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 26269                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 26270                                          
 26271 00001FEB 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 26272                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 26273                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26274 00001FEE 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 26275                                  	
 26276                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 26277 00001FF0 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26278                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 26279 00001FF5 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 26280                                  
 26281                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26282                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 26283                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 26284                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 26285                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26286                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26287                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 26288                                  
 26289                                  multi_try_i:
 26290 00001FF7 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 26291                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 26292                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26293 00001FFA 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 26294                                  
 26295                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26296                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26297                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26298                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26299                                  ;;endif
 26300                                  
 26301 00001FFC E841F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26302 00001FFF EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 26303                                  
 26304                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26305                                  %if 0
 26306                                  
 26307                                  multi_try_n:
 26308                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 26309                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 26310                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26311                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26312                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26313                                  ;endif
 26314                                  
 26315                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 26316                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 26317                                  
 26318                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 26319                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 26320                                  	mov	bx,ax
 26321                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 26322                                  
 26323                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 26324                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 26325                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 26326                                  
 26327                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26328                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 26329                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26330                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 26331                                  
 26332                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26333                                  	mov	bx,1
 26334                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26335                                  
 26336                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26337                                  
 26338                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26339                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26340                                          int     21h
 26341                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26342                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26343                                          int     21h
 26344                                  
 26345                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 26346                                  
 26347                                  %endif
 26348                                  
 26349                                  multi_pass_filter:
 26350 00002001 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 26351 00002004 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26352 00002006 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 26353 00002009 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26354 0000200B 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 26355 0000200E 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 26356                                  
 26357                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 26358 00002010 FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 26359 00002014 FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 26360                                  
 26361                                  multi_pass_coff:
 26362                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26363 00002018 EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.
 26364                                  
 26365                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26366                                  ; buffer command
 26367                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26368                                  
 26369                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26370                                  ;									      *
 26371                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26372                                  ;									      *
 26373                                  ; input :								      *
 26374                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26375                                  ; output:								      *
 26376                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26377                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26378                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26379                                  ;									      *
 26380                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26381                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26382                                  ; logic:								      *
 26383                                  ; {									      *
 26384                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26385                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26386                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26387                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26388                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26389                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26390                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26391                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26392                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26393                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26394                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26395                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26396                                  ;	};								      *
 26397                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26398                                  ; };									      *
 26399                                  ;									      *
 26400                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26401                                  
 26402                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26403                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26404                                  tryb:
 26405 0000201A 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26406 0000201D 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 26407                                  
 26408                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26409                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26410                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26411                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26412                                  ;;endif
 26413                                  
 26414                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26415                                  	; 18/12/2022
 26416 0000201F 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26417                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 26418 00002021 880E[121D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0

 26488                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26489                                  ; break command
 26490                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26491                                  
 26492                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26493                                  ;									    *
 26494                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26495                                  ;									    *
 26496                                  ; input :								    *
 26497                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26498                                  ; output:								    *
 26499                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26500                                  ;									    *
 26501                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26502                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 26503                                  ; logic:								    *
 26504                                  ; {									    *

 26506                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 26507                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26508                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26509                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26510                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 26511                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 26512                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26513                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 26514                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 26515                                  ;	};								    *
 26516                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *

 26518                                  ; };									    *
 26519                                  ;									    *
 26520                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26521

 26523                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)

 26532                                  ;;endif

 27916                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27917                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27918                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27919                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27920                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27921                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27922                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27923                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27924                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27925                                  
 27926                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27927                                  ;									  *
 27928                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27929                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27930                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27931                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27932                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27933                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27934                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27935                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27936                                  ; input :								  *
 27937                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27938                                  ; output:								  *
 27939                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27940                                  ;									  *
 27941                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27942                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27943                                  ; logic:								  *
 27944                                  ; {									  *
 27945                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27946                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27947                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27948                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27949                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27950                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27951                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27952                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27953                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27954                                  ;	     }								  *
 27955                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27956                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27957                                  ;	};								  *
 27958                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27959                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27960                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27961                                  ; };									  *
 27962                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27963

 28633                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 28637                                  ;
 28638                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28639                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28640                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28641                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28642                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28643                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28644                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28645                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28646                                  ;	 procedure.
 28647                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28648                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28649                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28650                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand

 28898 00002729 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; < 10 ?
 28899                                  	;cmp	ax,10		; < 10?
 28900 0000272B 720C                    	jb	short sln_last
 28901                                  
 28902 0000272D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 28903 0000272F F7F1                    	div	cx	; cx = 10
 28904 00002731 80CA30                  	or	dl,30h		; add "0" (= 30h) to make it an ascii.
 28905 00002734 8815                    	mov	[di],dl
 28906 00002736 4F                      	dec	di
 28907 00002737 EBF0                    	jmp	short sln_loop
 28908                                  
 28909                                  sln_last:
 28910 00002739 0C30                    	or	al,30h	; "0"
 28911 0000273B 8805                    	mov	[di],al
 28912 0000273D 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28913 0000273F E8050C                  	call	print		; show it.
 28914 00002742 5F                      	pop	di
 28915                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28916                                  	;pop	ds
 28917 00002743 07                      	pop	es
 28918 00002744 C3                      	retn

 28976                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28977                                  ;
 28978                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28979                                  ;
 28980                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28981                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28982                                  ;
 28983                                  ;	Output : none
 28984                                  ;
 28985                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28986                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28987                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28988                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28989                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28990                                  ;
 28991                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28992                                  
 28993                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28994                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28995                                  	; ds = cs
 28996 00002768 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 28997                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 28998                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28999 0000276B E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29000 0000276E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29001                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29002                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29003                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29004                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 29005                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29006                                  	; ds = cs
 29007 00002770 803E[CB1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 29008 00002775 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29009 00002777 A1[B21E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29010                                  lim_set:
 29011                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29012                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29013                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29014                                  ;limx:
 29015                                  	;retn
 29016                                  	
 29017                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29018                                  
 29019                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29020                                  ;
 29021                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29022                                  ;
 29023                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29024                                  ;	Output : none
 29025                                  ;
 29026                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29027                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29028                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29029                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29030                                  ;
 29031                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29032                                  
 29033                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29034                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29035 0000277A 1E                      	push	ds
 29036 0000277B BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29037 0000277E 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29038 00002780 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29039 00002784 2E891E[CF1E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29040 00002789 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29041 0000278B D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29042 0000278D A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29043 00002790 2EC606[CE1E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29044 00002796 1F                      	pop	ds
 29045                                  ;limx:
 29046 00002797 C3                      	retn
 29047                                  
 29048                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29049                                  ;
 29050                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29051                                  ;
 29052                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29053                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29054                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29055                                  ;
 29056                                  ;	Output : none
 29057                                  ;
 29058                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29059                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29060                                  ;
 29061                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29062                                  
 29063                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29064                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29065                                  	; ds = cs
 29066 00002798 803E[CE1E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29067                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29068                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29069                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29070 0000279D 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29071                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29072 0000279F B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29073 000027A2 8826[CE1E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29074                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29075                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29076 000027A6 1E                      	push	ds
 29077                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29078 000027A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29079 000027A9 2EA1[CF1E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29080 000027AD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29081 000027B0 1F                      	pop	ds
 29082                                  timx:
 29083 000027B1 C3                      	retn
 29084

 29103                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header

 29105 000027BC 0E                      	push	cs
 29106 000027BD 07                      	pop	es
 29107 000027BE BF[D11E]                	mov	di,ThreeComName
 29108 000027C1 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 29109 000027C4 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 29110 000027C6 5E                      	pop	si
 29111 000027C7 07                      	pop	es
 29112 000027C8 1F                      	pop	ds
 29113 000027C9 C3                      	retn

 29133                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29134                                  
 29135                                  %if 0
 29136                                  
 29137                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29138                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29139                                  
 29140                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29141                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29142                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29143                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29144                                  
 29145                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29146                                  ;
 29147                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29148                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29149                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29150                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29151                                  ;
 29152                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29153                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29154                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29155                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29156                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29157                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29158                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29159                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29160                                  ; available during the load.
 29161                                  ;
 29162                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29163                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29164                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29165                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29166                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29167                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29168                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29169                                  ;
 29170                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29171                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29172                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29173                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29174                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29175                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29176                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29177                                  ;
 29178                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29179                                  
 29180                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29181                                  
 29182                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29183                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29184                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29185                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29186                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29187                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29188                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29189                                  
 29190                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29191                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29192                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29193                                  
 29194                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29195                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29196                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29197                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29198                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29199                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29200                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29201                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29202                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29203                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29204                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29205                                  
 29206                                  InitVar:
 29207                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29208                                  	push	ax
 29209                                  	push	cx
 29210                                  	push	di
 29211                                  	push	es
 29212                                  
 29213                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29214                                  	push	cs
 29215                                  	pop	es
 29216                                  
 29217                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29218                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29219                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29220                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29221                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29222                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29223                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29224                                  
 29225                                  	cld
 29226                                  
 29227                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29228                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29229                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29230                                  
 29231                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29232                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29233                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29234                                  
 29235                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29236                                  
 29237                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29238                                  	pop	es
 29239                                  	pop	di
 29240                                  	pop	cx
 29241                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29242                                  
 29243                                  	retn
 29244                                  
 29245                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29246                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29247                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29248                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29249                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29250                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29251                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29252                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29253                                  
 29254                                  FixMem:
 29255                                  	push	ax
 29256                                  	push	bx
 29257                                  	push	cx
 29258                                  	push	dx
 29259                                  	push	es
 29260                                  
 29261                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29262                                  
 29263                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29264                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29265                                  
 29266                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29267                                  
 29268                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29269                                  
 29270                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29271                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29272                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29273                                  
 29274                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29275                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29276                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29277                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29278                                  
 29279                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29280                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29281                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29282                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29283                                  
 29284                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29285                                  
 29286                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29287                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29288                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29289                                  
 29290                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29291                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29292                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29293                                  	inc	bx
 29294                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29295                                  
 29296                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29297
